summary: This is an email chain from November 24, 2021, in which attorney Joe Nascimento alerts a colleague about a subpoena and deposition in the civil case Melissa Selinger v. Kimera Labs, Alexander Jelinek. The case involves allegations connecting a defendant's past work for Jeffrey Epstein to claims of sex discrimination, battery, and IIED. The email discusses procedural motions and mentions the inclusion of Epstein-related documents.

persons.name: Joe Nascimento
persons.context: The sender of the main email alerting a colleague about a subpoena and deposition in a civil case that connects to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Full name and signature of the attorney from the law firm AMSEL RABEN NASCIMENTO, PLLC, who sent the email.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: The recipient of Joe Nascimento's email, being alerted about the legal development.

persons.name: Melissa Selinger
persons.context: The plaintiff in the civil lawsuit 'Melissa Selinger v. Kimera Labs, Alexander Jelinek', a former employee suing on grounds including sex discrimination, battery, and IIED.

persons.name: Alexander Jelinek
persons.context: A defendant in the civil lawsuit, whose ex-husband is being sued and is being connected to actions while working for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the former employer of a defendant's ex-husband, with the plaintiff's motion including Epstein-related documents and allegations.

connections.description: Alexander Jelinek's ex-husband worked for Jeffrey Epstein, and this connection is being used in the civil lawsuit to link to alleged actions.
Colleagues or professional associates communicating about a legal development in a case involving Epstein connections.
Plaintiff and defendant in the civil lawsuit 'Melissa Selinger v. Kimera Labs, Alexander Jelinek'.

events.title: Scheduled deposition in Selinger v. Jelinek
events.description: A deposition was set for November 30, 2021, in the case Melissa Selinger v. Kimera Labs, Alexander Jelinek, but was stayed after a motion to quash was granted.

events.title: Subpoena served and motion activity
events.description: A subpoena for deposition was recently served, a motion to quash was filed and granted, a motion to reconsider was filed, and the court ordered a response.

keyFacts: A civil lawsuit, Melissa Selinger v. Kimera Labs, Alexander Jelinek, involves allegations connecting a defendant's past work for Jeffrey Epstein to claims of sex discrimination, battery, and intentional infliction of emotional distress (IIED).
The plaintiff's motion includes a copy of the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) related to Epstein and makes numerous factual allegations related to Epstein.
Legal procedural steps include a subpoena for a deposition set for November 30, 2021, a granted motion to quash, a filed motion to reconsider, and a court order for a response from the defendant.
